verse: स्वच्छन्दोपात्तदेहाय विशुद्धज्ञानमूर्तये । सर्वस्मै सर्वबीजाय सर्वभूतात्मने नम: ॥

terms.sandhyā: at the three junctures of the day (dawn, noon and sunset)
terms.samyak-saṅkalpaḥ: who has perfectly fixed his determination (that the object of his endeavor will be the Personality of Godhead)

vedabase.translation: Fixing the mind on Me, one should worship Me by his various prescribed duties, such as chanting the Gāyatrī mantra at the three junctures of the day. Such performances are enjoined by the Vedas and purify the worshiper of reactions to fruitive activities.

terms.विशुद्धज्ञानमूर्तये (viśuddhajñānamūrtay: to the embodiment of pure knowledge,
terms.सर्वभूतात्मने (sarvabhūtātmane): to the soul of all beings,

gpt.meaning: I bow down to the self willed embodiment of pure knowledge, who is the source of all and the soul of all beings.

bard.meaning: Evening worship, first actions prompted by the Vedas are my worship, done with right intention cleanses action.
